index.name: index
index.description:
Provides methods for creating, deleting, and interacting with ElasticSearch
indices.

Client.name: Client
Client.description:
Creates a new Elastical client associated with the specified _host_. The client
uses ElasticSearch's REST API to interact with the host, so connections are
established as needed and are not persistent.

props.name: auth
props.description:
Username and password (delimited by a ":") to
        pass to ElasticSearch using basic HTTP auth. If not specified, no
        authentication will be used. Be sure to set `options.protocol` to
        'https' unless you're comfortable sending passwords in plaintext.

props.name: curlDebug
props.description:
If `true`, runnable curl commands
        will be written to stderr for every request the client makes. This is
        useful for debugging requests by hand.

props.name: protocol
props.description:
Protocol to use. May be "http" or
        "https".

props.name: timeout
props.description:
Number of milliseconds to wait
        before aborting a request. Be sure to increase this if you do large bulk
        operations.

Index.name: Index
Index.description:
Provides methods for creating, deleting, and interacting with ElasticSearch
indices.

classitems.description:
Search options that must be passed as query parameters instead of in the
request body.
classitems.name: _SEARCH_PARAMS

classitems.description: Base URL for this client, of the form "http://host:port".
classitems.name: baseUrl

classitems.description: Port number for this client.
classitems.name: port

classitems.description:
Performs multiple document create/index/delete operations in a single request.

See `Index.bulk()` for detailed usage instructions.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/bulk.html)
classitems.name: bulk

params.name: operations
params.description:
Array of operations to perform. See
    `Index.bulk()` for a description of the expected object format.

classitems.description:
Get the number of matches for a query

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/count.html)
classitems.name: count

params.name: query
params.description: Query to get the number of match for.

classitems.description:
Creates a new index.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-create-index.html)
classitems.name: createIndex

params.name: options
params.description: Index options (see ElasticSearch docs for details).

props.name: index
props.description: Index instance for the newly created index.

classitems.description:
Deletes a document from the specified index. See `Index.delete()` for the
complete list of supported options.
classitems.name: delete

classitems.description:
Deletes the specified index or indices. If no indices are specified, **all**
indices on the server will be deleted.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-delete-index.html)
classitems.name: deleteIndex

params.name: names
params.description:
Name of the index to delete, or an array of
    names to delete multiple indices. If omitted, **all** indices will be
    deleted.

classitems.description:
Gets a document from the specified index based on its id.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/get.html)
classitems.name: get

props.name: fields
props.description:
Document field name or array of
      field names to retrieve. By default, all fields are retrieved.

props.name: ignoreMissing
props.description:
If `true`, an error will
      not be returned if the index, type, or document do not exist. Instead,
      a `null` document will be returned.

props.name: preference
props.description:
Controls which shard replicas the
      request should be executed on. By default, the operation will be
      randomized between the shard replicas. See the ElasticSearch docs for
      possible values.

props.name: realtime
props.description:
Whether or not to use realtime
      GET. See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the relevant shard
      will be refreshed before the get operation to ensure that it's
      searchable. This may cause heavy server load, so use with caution.

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      document will be routed to. If not specified, a hash of the document's
      id will be used. Note that an incorrectly routed get operation will
      fail, so it's best to leave this alone unless you know your business.

props.name: type
props.description:
If specified, the get operation will
      be limited to documents of this type.

props.name: doc
props.description:
Retrieved document or document fields,
      or `null` if the document was not found and `options.ignoreMissing` is
      `true`.

classitems.description:
Gets an Index instance for interacting with the specified ElasticSearch
index.
example:
var client = new require('elastical').Client(),
        tweets = client.getIndex('tweets');
classitems.name: getIndex

classitems.description:
Gets mapping definitions for the specified type within the specified index.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-put-mapping.html)
classitems.name: getMapping

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names.

params.name: type
params.description: Document type. If omitted, mappings for all type are returned.

classitems.description:
Gets settings for the specified index/indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-get-settings.html)
classitems.name: getSettings

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names.

classitems.description:
Adds a document to the specified index.

If the specified index doesn't exist, it will be created.

If a document already exists in that index with the specified _type_ and
_id_, it will be updated. Otherwise, a new document will be created.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/index_.html)
classitems.name: index

props.name: consistency
props.description:
Write consistency to use
      for this indexing operation. Permitted values are "one", "quorum" and
      "all". See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: create
props.description:
Only create the document if it
      doesn't already exist.

props.name: id
props.description:
Document id. One will be automatically
      generated if not specified.

props.name: percolate
props.description:
Percolation query to check against
      this document. See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the document will be
      made searchable immediately after it is indexed.

props.name: replication
props.description:
Replication mode for this
      indexing operation. Maybe be set to "sync" or "async".

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      document will be routed to. If not specified, a hash of the document's
      id will be used.

props.name: timeout
props.description:
How long to wait for the primary
      shard to become available to index this document before aborting. See
      the ElasticSearch docs for details. This should be a value like "5m"
      (5 minutes) or "15s" (15 seconds).

props.name: version
props.description:
Document version to create/update. If
      this is set and `options.version_type` is not set,
      `options.version_type` will automatically be set to "external".

props.name: version_type
props.description:
Version type (either
      "internal" or "external"). See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

classitems.description:
Checks whether the specified index or indices exist.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-indices-exists.html)
classitems.name: indexExists

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names to check.

props.name: exists
props.description:
`true` if all specified indices exist,
    `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Registers a mapping definition for the specified type within the specified
index or indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-put-mapping.html)
classitems.name: putMapping

params.name: names
params.description:
Index name or array of names to define the
    mapping within. If not specified, it will be defined in all indices.

params.name: mapping
params.description:
Mapping definition. See the [ElasticSearch
    docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/mapping/) for
    an overview.

classitems.description:
Refreshes the specified index or indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-refresh.html)
classitems.name: refresh

params.name: names
params.description:
Index name or array of names to refresh. If
    not specified, all indices will be refreshed.

classitems.description:
Searches for documents matching the given query.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/)
classitems.name: search

params.name: options
params.description:
Search options. Technically this argument is
    optional, but you'll almost always want to provide at least a query.

props.name: query
props.description:
Search query. This can be a simple
      string (in which case a "query_string" search will be performed) or a
      full query object. See the [ElasticSearch Query DSL docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/query-dsl/)
      for details.

props.name: explain
props.description:
If `true`, results will include
      an explanation of how the score was computed for each hit.

props.name: facets
props.description:
Facets to aggregate by. See the
      [ElasticSearch facets docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/facets/)
      for details.

props.name: fields
props.description:
Document field name or array of
      field names to retrieve. By default, all fields are retrieved.

props.name: filter
props.description:
Result filter. See the [ElasticSearch
      filtering docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/filter.html)
      for details.

props.name: from
props.description: Return results starting at this offset.

props.name: highlight
props.description:
Result highlighting options. See the
      [ElasticSearch highlighting docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/highlighting.html)
      for details.

props.name: index
props.description:
Index name or array of index
      names to search. By default all indices will be searched.

props.name: indices_boost
props.description:
Index boost options. See the
      [ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/index-boost.html)
      for details.

props.name: min_score
props.description:
If specified, documents with a score
      lower than this will be filtered out.

props.name: preference
props.description:
Controls which shard replicas the
      request should be executed on. By default, the operation will be
      randomized between the shard replicas. See the [ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/preference.html)
      for possible values.

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      search will be routed to.

props.name: script_fields
props.description:
Script expressions to evaluate for
      specific fields. See the [ElasticSearch script fields docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/script-fields.html)
      for details.

props.name: scroll
props.description:
Scroll timeout. If specified, nodes that
      participate in this search will maintain resources for this query
      until the timeout expires. See the [ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/scroll.html)
      for details.

props.name: scroll_id
props.description: Scroll id to use for this request.

props.name: search_type
props.description:
Search operation type to use. May be
      one of "query_and_fetch", "query_then_fetch", "dfs_query_and_fetch",
      "dfs_query_then_fetch", "count", or "scan". See the [ElasticSearch
      docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/search-type.html)
      for details.

props.name: sort
props.description:
Sort options. See the [ElasticSearch sort
      docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/sort.html)
      for details.

props.name: timeout
props.description:
Timeout after which the search will be
      aborted. Any hits that have been gathered before the timeout is
      reached will be returned. Default is no timeout.

props.name: track_scores
props.description:
Whether or not to compute
      scores when sorting by a field.

props.name: type
props.description:
Type name or array of type names
      to search. By default all types will be searched.

props.name: version
props.description:
If `true`, a version number will
      be returned for each hit.

classitems.description:
Registers a percolator for the given index or modifies the existing percolator
if one with the name already exists

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/pecolator/)
classitems.name: setPercolator

params.name: index
params.description:
Index name or array of index
      names to register the percolator.

params.name: percolator
params.description:
The identifier string of the percolator.
        This identifier is returned when a document matches
        the query in the percolator, either through percolate operation or
        through index opertation.

params.name: query
params.description:
Search query. Afull query object.
    See the [ElasticSearch Query DSL docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/query-dsl/)
    for details.

classitems.description: Retrieve the percolator doc

params.name: index
params.description: The index name to which the percolator is registered

classitems.description:
Test if a given doc matches a percolator for
the given index and document type

params.name: index
params.description:
The index name to which the document should be
     checked for matching percolators

params.name: type
params.description: The type name of the document

params.name: doc
params.description:
The document object which the registered percolators
     are matched against

classitems.description: Delete a registered percolator for the given index or indicies

params.name: index
params.description: Index name or array of index names

params.name: percolator
params.description: Name of the percolator to delete

classitems.description:
Registers a river with the cluster.
[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: putRiver

classitems.description:
Gets river config from the cluster.
[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: getRiver

classitems.description:
Deletes a river config from the cluster.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: deleteRiver

classitems.description: Makes an HTTP request using the `request` module.
classitems.name: _request

props.name: body
props.description:
Response body (parsed as JSON
      if possible).

classitems.description: Alias for index().
classitems.name: set
bulk

params.name: operations
params.description:
Array of operations to perform. See above for a
    description of the expected object format.

props.name: consistency
props.description:
Write consistency to use
        for these operations. Permitted values are "one", "quorum", and "all".
        See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the relevant shard
        will be refreshed after the delete operation. This may cause heavy
        server load, so use with caution.

props.name: index
props.description:
If specified the url endpoint
		for the bulk operations will include this index.  This is useful for
		scenarios where the root -bulk endpoint is prevented on a shared
		cluster.

classitems.description:
Creates a new index.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-create-index.html)
classitems.name: create

params.name: options
params.description: Index options (see ElasticSearch docs for details).

props.name: index
props.description: Index instance for the newly created index.

classitems.description:
Deletes the specified index or indices. If no indices are specified, **all**
indices on the server will be deleted.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-delete-index.html)
classitems.name: delete

params.name: names
params.description:
Name of the index to delete, or an array of
    names to delete multiple indices. If omitted, **all** indices will be
    deleted.

classitems.description:
Checks whether the specified index or indices exist.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-indices-exists.html)
classitems.name: exists

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names to check.

props.name: exists
props.description:
`true` if all specified indices exist,
      `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Retrieve the mappings for one or more indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-get-mapping.html)
classitems.name: count

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names.

params.name: type
params.description: Document type. If omitted, count for all types are returned.

params.name: query
params.description: query. If omitted, count for a match_all is returned.

classitems.description:
Retrieve the mappings for one or more indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-get-mapping.html)
classitems.name: getMapping

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names.

params.name: type
params.description: Document type. If omitted, mappings for all types are returned.

classitems.description:
Retrieve the settings for one or more indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-get-settings.html)
classitems.name: getSettings

params.name: names
params.description: Index name or array of names.

classitems.description:
Registers a mapping definition for the specified type within the specified
index or indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-put-mapping.html)
classitems.name: putMapping

params.name: names
params.description:
Index name or array of names to define the
    mapping within. If not specified, it will be defined in all indices.

params.name: mapping
params.description:
Mapping definition. See the [ElasticSearch
    docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/mapping/) for
    an overview.

classitems.description:
Refreshes the specified index or indices.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-refresh.html)
classitems.name: refresh

params.name: names
params.description:
Index name or array of names to refresh. If not
    specified, all indices will be refreshed.

classitems.description:
Registers a river with the cluster.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: putRiver

classitems.description:
Gets river config from the cluster.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: getRiver

classitems.description:
Deletes a river config from the cluster.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/river/)
classitems.name: deleteRiver

classitems.description: Deletes a document from this index.
classitems.name: delete

props.name: consistency
props.description:
Write consistency to use
      for this indexing operation. Permitted values are "one", "quorum" and
      "all". See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: ignoreMissing
props.description:
If `true`, an error will
      not be returned if the index, type, or document do not exist.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the relevant shard
      will be refreshed after the delete operation. This may cause heavy
      server load, so use with caution.

props.name: replication
props.description:
Replication mode for this
      indexing operation. Maybe be set to "sync" or "async".

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      operation will be routed to. Note that an incorrectly routed operation
      will fail, so it's best to leave this alone unless you know your
      business.

props.name: version
props.description:
Document version to delete. If
      the specified document's version differs from this, an error will be
      returned and the document will not be deleted.

props.name: query
props.description:
To perform removal using a query. Warning:
      id and all other options except ignoreMissing will be ignored.

classitems.description:
Deletes this index.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-delete-index.html)
classitems.name: deleteIndex

classitems.description:
Checks whether this index exists on the server.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-indices-exists.html)
classitems.name: exists

classitems.description:
Gets a document from this index based on its id.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/get.html)
classitems.name: get

props.name: fields
props.description:
Document field name or array of
      field names to retrieve. By default, all fields are retrieved.

props.name: ignoreMissing
props.description:
If `true`, an error will
      not be returned if the index, type, or document do not exist. Instead,
      a `null` document will be returned.

props.name: preference
props.description:
Controls which shard replicas the
      request should be executed on. By default, the operation will be
      randomized between the shard replicas. See the ElasticSearch docs for
      possible values.

props.name: realtime
props.description:
Whether or not to use realtime
      GET. See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the relevant shard
      will be refreshed before the get operation to ensure that it's
      searchable. This may cause heavy server load, so use with caution.

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      document will be routed to. If not specified, a hash of the document's
      id will be used. Note that an incorrectly routed get operation will
      fail, so it's best to leave this alone unless you know your business.

props.name: type
props.description:
If specified, the get operation will
      be limited to documents of this type.

props.name: doc
props.description:
Retrieved document or document fields,
      or `null` if the document was not found and `options.ignoreMissing` is
      `true`.

classitems.description:
Gets the mapping definition for this index.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-get-mapping.html)
classitems.name: getMapping

params.name: type
params.description: Document type. If omitted, mappings for all types are returned.

classitems.description:
Adds a document to this index.

If a document already exists in this index with the specified _type_ and
_id_, it will be updated. Otherwise, a new document will be created.

[ElasticSearch docs](http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/index_.html)
classitems.name: index

props.name: consistency
props.description:
Write consistency to use
      for this indexing operation. Permitted values are "one", "quorum" and
      "all". See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: create
props.description:
Only create the document if it
      doesn't already exist.

props.name: id
props.description:
Document id. One will be automatically
      generated if not specified.

props.name: percolate
props.description:
Percolation query to check against
      this document. See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

props.name: refresh
props.description:
If `true`, the document will be
      made searchable immediately after it is indexed.

props.name: replication
props.description:
Replication mode for this
      indexing operation. Maybe be set to "sync" or "async".

props.name: routing
props.description:
Value that determines what shard this
      document will be routed to. If not specified, a hash of the document's
      id will be used.

props.name: timeout
props.description:
How long to wait for the primary
      shard to become available to index this document before aborting. See
      the ElasticSearch docs for details. This should be a value like "5m"
      (5 minutes) or "15s" (15 seconds).

props.name: version
props.description:
Document version to create/update. If
      this is set and `options.version_type` is not set,
      `options.version_type` will automatically be set to "external".

props.name: version_type
props.description:
Version type (either
      "internal" or "external"). See the ElasticSearch docs for details.

classitems.description: Alias for index().
classitems.name: set

classitems.description:
Iterates over all items in _obj_ if _obj_ is an array, or over all enumerable
properties if _obj_ is an object, calling the _callback_ for each one.
classitems.name: each

params.name: obj
params.description: Array or object to iterate over.

params.name: value
params.description: Value of the current array item or property.

params.name: key
params.description:
Index (if _obj_ is an array) or key (if _obj_ is an
      object).

classitems.description:
Returns a new object containing a deep merge of the enumerable properties of all
passed objects. Properties in later arguments take precedence over properties
with the same name in earlier arguments. Object values are deep-cloned. Array
values are _not_ deep-cloned.
classitems.name: merge

params.name: obj
params.description: One or more objects to merge.

return.description: New object with merged values from all other objects.

classitems.description:
Like `merge()`, but augments the first passed object with a deep merge of the
enumerable properties of all other passed objects, rather than returning a
brand new object.
classitems.name: mix

params.name: obj
params.description: One or more objects to mix into _target_.

return.description: Reference to the same _target_ object that was passed in.

classitems.description:
Returns an array containing the values of all enumerable properties of _obj_. If
_obj_ is already an array, a copy of it will be returned.
classitems.name: values
